bibl.title: Letter from Lunsford D. Fricks to Henry Rose Carter, October 26, 1921

div1.p: Fricks apologizes for his efforts to convince Carter to attend the Hot Spring malaria meeting.

div1.head: Letter from Lunsford D. Fricks to Henry Rose Carter, October 26, 1921
div1.opener:
National Malaria Committee
Room 17 Court House Bldg.
Mal C.
Meeting
OFFICE OF
MALARIA INVESTIGATIONS
JC
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
MEMPHIS. TENN.
October 26, 1921.
Asst. Surgeon-General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Public Health Service,
2121 California St., N.W.,
Washington, D.C.
Dear Doctor:
div1.p:
Your note of October 22nd just received.
I knew I was doing something which you would not
want me to do when I wrote Dr. Ferrell relative to
your attendance at the Hot Springs meetings. Per-
sonally I apologize, but as Secretary of the National
Malaria Committee, I have no apologies to make be-
cause I feel you ought to be with us and that I
should not have done my official duty unless I had
exhausted every means of securing your attendance.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, L. D. Fricks, Secretary.
NATIONAL MALARIA COMMITTEE.
